newsitem.title: INDONESIA: INDONESIAN STOCKS - factors to watch - April 16.
newsitem.headline: INDONESIAN STOCKS - factors to watch - April 16.

text.p: Following are some of the main factors likely to affect Indonesian stocks on Wednesday:
* On Tuesday, the Dow Jones industrial average posted its second biggest one-day gain ever as it ended up 135.26 points, or 2.10 percent, at 6,587.16.

* The Jakarta stock exchange's president director Cyril Noerhadi said the exchange was studying alleged irregularities involving trading of small-capitalised Bank Pikko shares early last week and vowed to punish those found guilty, news reports said.
* On Tuesday, the Jakarta composite index fell 3.89 points, to close at 631.27 points.
* On Wednesday, the rupiah was quoted at 2,407.75/08.25 at 0130 GMT, compared with an opening of 2,407.50/08.50.
* Conglomerate Bimantara after reports that the firm planned to pay a dividend of 20 rupiah per share for 1996 against 12.30 rupiah in 1995.
* Small-cap Bank Pikko following reports of alleged irregularities involving trading of the bank's shares.
* Retailer Matahari following large trading of its shares on the cross board. * Textile firm Texmaco Perkasa and Bank Niaga after announcements of rises in their 1996 net profits.
* Transport firm Mitra Rajasa after reports it expected to book 20-percent net profit growth in 1996.
